profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-04-23T13:25-0400

did.unittitle: Mayer Collection of Fat Liberation

repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: Researcher and activist in the fat liberation movement and graduate student at the University of Connecticut; also known by the pseudonym Aldebaran.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Researcher and activist in the fat liberation movement and graduate student at the University of Connecticut; also known by the pseudonym Aldebaran.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence relating to fat Americans and strategies for their liberation and societal restraints, chiefly with persons associated with Fat Underground (Los Angeles), Fat Liberation Front (New Haven), Fat Liberator Publications (New Haven, Minneapolis), and National Association to Aid Fat Americans. Related books, comic books, pamphlets, periodicals and boxed game have been removed from the collection and cataloged as part of the Alternative Press Collection. Items with a ∅ symbol have not been retained in the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series II: Books and Periodicals ( undated, 1967-1983)
Series III: Comic Books, Pamphlets, Publications ( undated 1973-1982)

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: The following materials have been separated from the collection and cataloged:
Twenty buttons have been transferred to the APC Button Collection.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Mayer Collection Of Fat Liberation. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to alternative and minority publications, presses, cultures and lifestyles. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the Reading Room desk.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.
